lexUnit.name: rags.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: rags old or tattered clothes.

sentence.text: To see and smell the greasy rags of the poor ; the silk-slashed , perfumed doublets , velvet hose and precious buckled shoes of the rich .
Then Eddie said , ‘ You 'll be in the next shot so if you 'll slip into your rags we 'll … ’
In spite of her rags and the marquis 's rough treatment , he had never seen a more entrancing girl , nor one who had affected him so instantly .
And you come dancing up in your stinking rags as if it did n't matter !
She seldom wore the pretty dresses or smart suits that Scarlet bought her , preferring her rags .
They inevitably knock on the door on the one evening of the month when you 're dolled up in your glad rags to go out on the town .
Red Hand , his gaudy rags fluttering around him , jumped through the slush towards them .
The soul of a princess in her gypsy rags , Doomed to fret in her humble stall …
Each is tarnished by sin and , clothed in these acts of righteousness , I am clothed in rags before Almighty God .
we were in rags and a lot of us had no shoes .
There are areas where every child is in rags and learns to be a thief from the age of three .
The only clothes were the greasy rags of the old woman .
We shall all be in rags … ’
Her exquisitely modelled buttocks and satin thighs were visible under those ridiculous rags as she walked towards the clearing .
“ I have not eaten and I am in rags and all I ask is a share of your fire before I am turned out into the cold night again …
` Children barefoot , and dressed in rags or old flour sacks , " Mrs Theobald said .
The situation was confused for him by the fact that many of the people he had seen in the church of Gesù Nuovo , the ones who had come to pray and adore , were dressed in rags .
And he was , as always , a picture of health , dressed in black rags and black boots and twitching maniacally .
She glimpsed a hunched figure dressed in rags .
In the meantime , she wore the same old rags week after week , lived in poverty and was ` faithful " to her ex-lover .
Lili 's hands were pushed deep into a dark fur coat with upturned collar , under which she wore picturesque rags that had been carefully slashed to show as much of her body as possible .
Her hands are claws she keeps concealed within her rags and tatters .
Then , throwing off his tattered rags and appearing in " bright , shining raiment " , the angel raised his staff and cried :
Out on the floor , on the sawdust , some revellers , in jaunty rags , were forming a circle .
All were in old , tattered clothes , some in outright rags ; many were barefoot and hatless .

The drinkers , drunk as they were , full of glasses of wine , fell back from the man , who , with the rags he wore , had surprisingly clean white underpants -- what struck Rab -- raised his coat and squatted down as the most natural thing in the world .
What a contrast to those wet rags she wore in the movie !
